Welcome to KMeans++ using CuPy or NumPy’s documentation!¶

kmeanspp_numpy.py¶

Implements the kmeans++ algorithm for finding an initial codebook for the subsequent kmeans iterations. Uses the NumPy library.

src.kmeanspp_numpy.distances_squared(points_not_choosed_thus_far: numpy.ndarray, center: numpy.ndarray)[source]¶

distances_squared. Computes the squared norm of differences between all points in points_not_choosed_thus_far and the center point.

Parameters

points_not_choosed_thus_far – points not choosen thus far by the selection process

points are stored as columns :type points_not_choosed_thus_far: numpy.ndarray :param center: newly choosen center point :type center: numpy.ndarray

src.kmeanspp_numpy.kmeanspp(train_set: numpy.ndarray, num_codevectors: int, verbose: bool = True)[source]¶

kmeanspp. Runs the kmeans++ algorithm. The computations precision is inherited from the train_set.

Parameters

  • train_set (numpy.ndarray) – training set, points as columns

  • num_codevectors (int) – number of codevectors in the in the initial codebook

  • verbose (bool) – print additional information while running

kmeanspp_cupy.py¶

Implements the kmeans++ algorithm for finding an initial codebook for the subsequent kmeans iterations. Uses the CuPy library.

src.kmeanspp_cupy.distances_squared(points_not_choosed_thus_far: cupy.core.core.ndarray, center: cupy.core.core.ndarray)[source]¶

distances_squared. Computes the squared norm of differences between all points in points_not_choosed_thus_far and the center point.

Parameters

points_not_choosed_thus_far – points not choosen thus far by the selection process

points are stored as columns :type points_not_choosed_thus_far: cp.ndarray :param center: newly choosen center point :type center: cp.ndarray

src.kmeanspp_cupy.kmeanspp(train_set: cupy.core.core.ndarray, num_codevectors: int, verbose: bool = True)[source]¶

kmeanspp. Runs the kmeans++ algorithm. The computations precision is inherited from the train_set.

Parameters

  • train_set (cp.ndarray) – training set, points as columns

  • num_codevectors (int) – number of codevectors in the in the initial codebook

  • verbose (bool) – print additional information while running
